page.title: 06THISTLETON (GREENHALGH)
page.content: This is a lovely village retaining much of its original charm. The aim locally is to keep it as unspoiled as possible. The farms are built on the roadside, intermingled with cottages. The farm land lies to the rear of each farm. One cottage built about 200 years ago is thatched. The cottage is low, the roof has a long slope and the windows are very small. Most of the houses are built of handmade red bricks. Some retain their original appearance whilst others have been rendered and whitened. Most of them have slate roofs. There are about seventeen houses, four of which are semi-detached. Thistleton is a prime example of a traditional Fylde village.
